verbs.description: jargonize (third-person singular simple present jargonizes, present participle jargonizing, simple past and past participle jargonized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To speak or write using jargon.
examples: He provokes, inspires, pontificates and jargonizes unto "hegemony" and "archaic parental imagos."

entries.meaning: (transitive) To convert into jargon; to express using jargon.
examples: But the committeemen were not to be diverted by the long-winded, jargonized explanations of the Nielsen modus operandi.
